revised_title: A New Proteid Substance in Blood Serum and Its Effect on Coagulation
tldr: The author discovered a new proteid substance in blood serum that plays a significant role in the coagulation process. This substance, called serum fibrinogen, increases the amount of fibrin formed and prevents blood clotting when injected into a living animal. The author suggests that this substance, present in small amounts, can help explain discrepancies in previous coagulation studies and questions the power of fibrin ferment to produce so-called intoxication.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Blood Coagulation
